task.title: Connect to a Server
task.shortdesc: Create a profile using the Altair One tool in the VS Code to connect to a server.

context.p: The authentication is integrated with VS Code, hence the credentials are not required while creating a profile. The VS Code re-directs to Okta login page for authentication. You can set the created profile as a default profile.
Refresh the Remote Packs after adding the profile to authenticate your credentials using Okta login page. Remote packs get activated after authenticating your credentials.

The following list of content packs will be available once you bootstrap the system:
altair.system - which has the details as to how to create content, a relation, an event, and other entities. This has the base interfaces. For example, what are an application, application version, and execution environment.
altair.pbs - is an execution environment pack
altair.local - is an execution environment pack
altair.versioning - pack which provides the default way of versioning entities. It is based on the Git style of versioning. This is a decoupling way of versioning. You can create your own pack with your own versioning. You can also use the other userâ€™s versioning packs as well.
altair.open.faas - is an execution environment pack. Even the Execution Environment is a content pack within the Object Store.

An administrator creates the execution environment, onboards the environment, and shares it with other users. The other users can use the shared execution environment and execute an action on top of it.
Perform the following steps to create a profile.

step.cmd: Click Altair One Tool icon () in the VS Code.
Click at the top pane in the left panel.
step.stepresult:
The Create Profile is displayed in the right panel. Create Profile
Create Profile

step.cmd: Select the Execution Environment from the drop-down menu.

step.stepresult:
The created profile will be listed. Created Profile
Created Profile

step.cmd: Right-click the profile and select Make Default to set it as a default profile.

info.note: Refresh the Remote Packs after adding the profile to authenticate your credentials using Okta login page. Remote packs get activated after authenticating your credentials.

step.cmd: Click Altair One Content Pack icon ().
step.stepresult:
The Remote Packs deployed are listed: Remote Packs
Remote Packs
